column2:
<scope>
The province scope in which the unit spawns.
column4: Spawns a specific unit for the current scope in the defined province scope.
column5: Units can be found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/units/*.txt.

column2:
<int>
The amount of absolutism to add or subtract.
column4: Adds absolutism to the current scope.
column5: No effect if Absolutism isn't active.

column2:
<culture>
The culture to add.
<scope>
The culture to add, derived from the scope.
column3:
add_accepted_culture = english
add_accepted_culture = ENG
add_accepted_culture = event_target:my_event_target
add_accepted_culture = variable:my_variable
column4: Adds a new accepted culture to the current scope.
column5:
Cultures are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/cultures/*.txt.
Can utilise Event Scope Values.

column2:
<policy>
The policy to add.
column4: Adds a policy for the current scope.
column5:
Policies are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/policies/*.txt.
Won't work if the policy triggers are not met by the country, or there are no free policy slots.

column2:
<int>
The amount of power to add or subtract.
column4: Adds Administrative power to the current scope.

column2:
<int>
The amount of technologies to add.
column4: Adds ADM technologies to the current scope.
column5: You cannot remove technologies.

column2:
<float>
The amount of army professionalism to add or subtract.
column4: Adds Army Professionalism to the current scope.

column2:
<int>
The amount of army tradition to add or subtract.
column4: Adds Army Tradition to the current scope.

column2:
<int>
The amount of authority to add.
column4: Adds authority to the current scope. Used in Religious Reforms that use authority.
column5: No effect if the country does not hold a religion using authority.

column2:
target = <scope>
The country to add the casus belli against.
type = <cb>
The casus belli to add.
months = <months>
The number of months the casus belli lasts for.
column4: Adds a casus belli for the current scope against the defined scope.
column5: Casus belli are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/cb_types/*.txt

column2:
<aspect>
The church aspect to add.
column4: Adds the defined aspect to the current scope.
column5:
Church Aspects are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/church_aspects/00_church_aspects.txt.
No effect if the country does not hold a religion using uses_church_power and the aspect set in aspects.
Does not work with Blessings.

column2:
<int>
The amount of church power to add or subtract.
column4: Adds Church Power to the current scope.
column5: No effect if the country does not hold a religion using uses_church_power.

column2:
<float>
The amount to add or subtract.
column4: Adds corruption to the current scope.

column2:
name = <name>
The event modifier to add.
duration = <days>
Optional. The number of days to add the country modifier for.
hidden = yes
Optional. Whether the country modifier is hidden in the government view.
desc = <string
Optional. The string used to override the automatic duration string.
column4: Adds an event modifier to the current scope as a country modifier.

column2:
<int>
The amount of devotion to add or subtract.
column4: Adds devotion to the current scope.
column5: No effect if not a government using has_devotion.

column2:
<int>
The amount of power to add or subtract.
column4: Adds Diplomatic power to the current scope.

column2:
<int>
The amount of technologies to add.
column4: Adds DIP technologies to the current scope.
column5: You cannot remove technologies.

column2:

The event modifier to add.
disaster = <disaster>
The disaster to apply the modifier to.

The duration for the modifier to be active for.
column4: Applies an event modifier to the current scope that is removed when the disaster is over, or the duration runs out.
column5: Disasters are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/disasters/*.txt

column2:
disaster = <disaster>
The disaster to alter.

The amount of progress to add or subtract.
column4: Adds progress towards an already declared (conditions for disaster are met since at least a month) disaster
column5: Disasters are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/disasters/*.txt

column2:
<int>
The amount of doom to add.
column4: Adds doom to the current scope. Used in Religious Reforms that use doom.
column5: No effect if the country does not hold a religion using doom.

column2:
estate = <estate>
The estate to apply the modifier to.

The text to display in the Influence tooltip for this modifier.
influence = <int>
The amount of influence to add or subtract.
duration = <days>
The duration for which this modifier is active.
column4: Adds an influence modifier for the defined estate used by the current scope.
column5: Estates are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/estates/*.txt

column2:
estate = <estate>
The estate to apply the loyalty to.
loyalty = <int>
The amount of loyalty to add or subtract.
column4: Adds loyalty for the defined estate used by the current scope.

column2:

The estate to apply the modifier to.
desc = <string>
The text to display in the Influence tooltip for this modifier.

The amount of loyalty to add or subtract.
duration = <days>
The duration for which this modifier is active.
column4: Adds an loyalty modifier for the defined estate used by the current scope.
column5: Estates are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/estates/*.txt

column2:

The faction to add.

column5: Factions are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/factions/.

column2:

The faction to add influence to.

The amount of influence to add.
column4: Adds influence for the defined faction.
column5: Mimics the influence boost from pressing the button in the faction window.

column2:
<int>

column4: Adds Fervor to the current scope.
column5: No effect if the country does not hold a religion using fervor.

Which government mechanic to add power to.

Which pool type to add the power to. ADM, DIP or MIL

The amount of power to add.
column4: Changes the pool size of one of the power pools within a government mechanic.
column5:
List of government mechanics:
russian_mechanic feudal_theocracy_mechanic tribal_federation_mechanic mamluk_mechanic iqta_mechanic

column2:
<int>
The amount of progress to add or subtract.

column5: No effect if the country does not hold a religion using uses_harmony.

<religion>
The religion to harmonize.
column4: Adds a religion to the list of Harmonized religions for the current scope.
column5: No effect if the country does not hold a religion using uses_harmony.

column2:
<int>
The amount of harmony to add or subtract.
column4: Adds Harmony to the current scope.
column5: No effect if the country does not hold a religion using uses_harmony.

column2:
<int>
The amount to add or subtract from the claim.
column4: Adds to the current scope's heir claim.

column2:

column4: Adds the defined personality to the current heir.
column5: Ruler personalities are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/ruler_personalities/00_core.txt

column2:

column4: Adds to the local heir's support in an Elective Monarchy.

column2:
<scope>

column2:
<scope>

column4: Makes the defined scope a historical rival of the current scope.

column2:

column4: Adds horde unity to the current scope.
column5: No effect if not a government using nomad.

column2:
<idea>
The idea to add.
column4: Adds an idea for the current scope.
column5:
Ideas are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/ideas/*.txt.
Won't work if the idea isn't present in a National Idea set or a taken Ideagroups set for the country.

column2:
<ideagroup>
The ideagroup to add.
column4: Adds an ideagroup for the current scope.
column5:
Ideagroups are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/ideas/*.txt.
Won't work if the country doesn't have any free ideagroup slots.

column2:
<int>
The amount of influence to add or subtract.
column4: Adds Imperial Influence for the current scope.
column5: No effect if not emperor.

column4: Changes the value of an Incident for the current scope.
column5:
Incidents are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/isolationism/*.txt
No effect if the country does not hold a religion using uses_isolationism.

column4: Adds mercantilism to the current scope.

column2:

column4: Adds meritocracy to the current scope.
column5: No effect if not a government using has_meritocracy.

column2:

column4: Adds Military power to the current scope.

column4: Adds MIL technologies to the current scope.
column5: You cannot remove technologies.

column5: No effect if the country does not hold a religion using papacy.

column5: No effect if the country does not hold a religion using has_patriarchs.

The amount of piety to add or subtract.
column4: Adds Piety to the current scope.
column5: No effect if the country does not hold a religion using uses_piety.

The value to take from scope, to add or subtract.

name = <name>

Optional. The number of days to add the ruler modifier for.
hidden = yes
Optional. Whether the ruler modifier is hidden in the government view.

Optional. The string used to override the automatic duration string.
column4: Adds an event modifier to the current scope as a ruler modifier.

The ruler personality to add.
column4: Adds the defined personality to the current ruler.
column5: Ruler personalities are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/ruler_personalities/00_core.txt

column5: 1 is equal to 1 sailor.

The amount of influence to add or subtract.

column5: No effect if not emperor.

column2:
<int>
The amount of republican tradition to add or subtract.
column4: Adds republican tradition to the current scope.
column5:
Scales to the government's election cycle duration.
No effect if not a government using republic.

column2:
<int>
The amount to add or subtract.
column4: Adds splendor to the current scope.
column5: Splendor is used to purchase Age abilities.

The country to add spy network for.
value = <int>
The amount of spy network to add or subtract.
column4: Adds spy network in the current scope for the defined scope.

column2:

The country to add spy network in.
value = <int>
The amount of spy network to add or subtract.
column4: Adds spy network for the current scope in the defined scope.

column2:
<int>
The amount to add or subtract.
column4: Adds stability to the current scope.

column2:

The amount of tariff value to add or subtract.
column4: Adds tariff value to the current scope.
column5: Tariff value is the ducats sent to an overlord by subjects such as colonial nations.

The amount of ducats to add or subtract.
column4: Adds ducats to the current scope.

column2:

The amount of tribal allegiance to add or subtract.
column4: Adds tribal allegiance to the current scope.
column5: No effect if not a government using tribal_federation_mechanic.

column2:
<scope>
The country to add a truce against.
column4: Creates a truce between the defined scope and the current scope.
column5: The truce length is the default white peace truce length.

column2:
who = <scope>
The country trust will be added with.
value = <int>
The amount of trust to add or subtract.
mutual = yes Optional. Whether to apply the trust change to both countries.
column4: Adds trust with the defined scope for the current scope.
column5: Used in conjuction with the Diplomatic Feedback mechanic from The Cossacks DLC.

column2:
<int>
The amount to add or subtract.
column4: Adds war exhaustion to the current scope.

column2:
<float>
The amount of manpower to add or subtract.
column4: Adds manpower to the current scope, as a percentage of total yearly manpower.
column5: 1 is equal to 100% of total yearly manpower.

column2:
<float>
The amount of sailors to add or subtract.
column4: Adds sailors to the current scope, as a percentage of total yearly sailors.
column5: 1 is equal to 100% of total yearly sailors.

column2:
<float>
The amount of income to add or subtract..
column4: Adds ducats equal to the years of income defined.
column5: 1 is equal to 1 year of income, based of a country's current monthly income.

column2:
<scope>
The province scope in which the artillery spawns.
column4: Spawns an artillery unit for the current scope in the defined province scope.
column5: Uses the currently selected artillery unit.

column2:
<scope>
The country to break the marriage with.
column4: Breaks the current scope's royal marriage with the defined scope.

column2:
<scope>
The country to break the union with.
column4: Breaks the current scope's union with the defined scope.

column2:
<scope>
The province scope in which the cavalry spawns.
column4: Spawns a cavalry unit for the current scope in the defined province scope.
column5: Uses the currently selected cavalry unit.

column2:
<int>
The amount to add or subtract from the ruler's ADM skill.
column4: Adds ADM skill to the current ruler.

column2:
yes
Boolean.
column4: Makes a consort regent into the current ruler for the current scope.

column2:
<int>
The amount to add or subtract from the ruler's DIP skill.
column4: Adds DIP skill to the current ruler.

column2:
<government>
The government to change to.
column4: Changes the government of the current scope.
column5: Governments are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/governments/*.txt.

column2:
<gfxculture>
The graphical culture to assign.
column4: Changes the current scope's graphical culture. Graphical culture determines the unit models, advisor portraits, etc that a country uses.
column5: Graphical cultures are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/graphicalculturetype.txt.

column2:
<int>
The amount to add or subtract from the heir's ADM skill.
column4: Adds ADM skill to the current heir.

column2:
<int>
The amount to add or subtract from the heir's DIP skill.
column4: Adds DIP skill to the current heir.

column2:
<int>
The amount to add or subtract from the heir's MIL skill.
column4: Adds MIL skill to the current heir.

column2:
<int>
The amount to add or subtract from the ruler's MIL skill.
column4: Adds MIL skill to the current ruler.

column2:
<deity>
The personal deity to add.
column4: Changes the current personal deity for the current scope.
column5:
Personal Deities are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/personal_deities/*.txt.
No effect if the country does not hold a religion using personal_deity.

column2:
trade_goods = <tradegood>
The trade good to change.
key = <string>
The localisation key to display in the Trade Good's price tooltip.
value = <float>
The percentage to change the value by.
duration = <days>
The duration for the value to stay changed for.
column4: Changes the price of a trade good globally.
column5:
Tradegood prices are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/prices/*.txt
The new price is the base price + (base price * value)
duration accepts -1 for unlimited duration.

column2:
<culture>
The culture to change to, from /Europa Universalis IV/common/cultures/.<scope>
The culture to change to, derived from the scope.
column3:
change_primary_culture = english
change_primary_culture = ENG
change_primary_culture = event_target:my_event_target
change_primary_culture = variable:my_variable
column4: Changes the primary culture of the current scope.
column5:
Cultures are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/cultures/*.txt.
Can utilise Event Scope Values.

column2:
<religion>
The religion to change to.
<scope>
The religion to change to, derived from the scope.
column3:
change_religion = catholic
change_religion = event_target:my_event_target
change_religion = variable:my_variable
column4: Changes the religion of the current scope.
column5:
Religions are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/religions/*.txt
Can utilise Event Scope Values.
Does not accept TAG scopes.

column2:
<int>
The amount of swing towards statists or organgists.
column4: Changes the Organist-Statist balance.
column5: Positive moves towards Orangist, negative moves towards Statists.

column2:
<scope>
The scope to change to.
column3:
change_tag = FRA
change_tag = ROOT
change_tag = event_target:my_country
column4: Changes current scope to <scope> tag.

The technology group to change to.
column4: Changes the technology group of the current scope.
column5:
Technology Groups are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/technology.txt.
Doesn't change units, use change_unit_type.

column2:
<type>
The unit type to change to.
column4: Change the unit type for the current scope.
column5: The unit types correspond the the technology groups found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/technology.txt.

column2:
<key>
The name key to clear.
column4: Clears a saved name key.
column5: Use this after using the saved name in an effect.

column2:
<flag>
The unique string of the flag to clear.
column4: Clears a consort flag for the current scope's consort.

column2:
<flag>
The unique string of a country flag to clear.
column4: Clears a defined country flag for the current scope.

column2:
<flag>
The unique string of the flag to clear.
column4: Clears a heir flag for the current scope's heir.

column2:
<flag>
The unique string of the flag to clear.
column4: Clears a ruler flag for the current scope's ruler.

column2:
yes
Boolean
column4: Causes owned cores of the current scope to be released as nations and for them to take a percentage of the current scope's owned provinces.

column2:
yes
Boolean.
column4: Converts a female heir into a general.

column2:
yes
Boolean.
column4: Converts a female ruler into a general.

column2:
yes
Boolean.
column4: Converts a male heir into a general.

column2:
yes
Boolean.
column4: Converts a male ruler into a general.

column2:
id = <id>
The event id to fire.
days = <days>
Optional. The number of days to wait after the effect is executed to fire the event.
random = <days>
Optional. The max number of additional days that can be added to the daysparameter for randomness.
tooltip = <string>
Optional. The tooltip to display in the effect tooltip country_event is used in.
column4: Fire a country event for the current country scope.
column5: You cannot fire the same event within itself.

column2:
<int>
The amount of navy tradition to use in generation.
column4: Generates an new admiral for the current scope.

column2:
<advisor>
The advisor to create.
column4: Adds the defined advisor to the current scope.
column5: Defaults the advisor's location to the capital, and religion and culture to the current scope's.

column2:
<scope>
The country to create an alliance with.
column4: Creates an alliance between the current scope and the defined scope.

column2:
<int>
The amount of army tradition to use in generation.
column4: Generates an new conquistador for the current scope.

column2:
<int>
The amount of navy tradition to use in generation.
column4: Generates an new explorer for the current scope.

column2:
<int>
The amount of armu tradition to use in generation.
column4: Generates an new general for the current scope.

column2:
<scope>
The country to create an guarantee with.
column4: Creates an guarantee over the defined scope for the current scope.

column2:
<estate>
The estate to create the independent nation from.
column4: Creates an independent nation from provinces owned by the specified estate within the current scope's owned provinces.
column5:
Estates are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/estates/*.txt
The additional parameters for the independent nation are found within an estate's file.

column2:
<estate>
The estate to create the independent nation from.
column4: Creates an independent nation from provinces owned by the specified estate within the current scope's owned provinces.
column5:
Estates are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/estates/*.txt
Created with the religion that the majority of the provinces that the defined estate own holds.
The additional parameters for the independent nation are found within an estate's file.

column2:
<scope>
The country to make into a march.
column4: Makes the defined scope a march subject of the current scope.
column5: Uses the march subject type.

column2:
<scope>
The country to create an royal marriage with.
column4: Creates a royal marriage between the current scope and the defined scope.

column2:
subject_type = <type>
The subject type to use.
subject = <scope>
The scope to make the subject.
column4: Makes the defined scope into the defined subject type under the current scope.
column5: Subject types are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/subject_types/*.txt.

column2:
<scope>
The country to make into the junior partner.
column4: Makes the defined scope a junior partner in a personal union with the current scope.

column2:
<scope>
The country to make into a vassal.
column4: Makes the defined scope a vassal subject of the current scope.
column5: Uses the vassal subject type.

column2:
<scope>
The country to declare against.
column4: Creates a no casus belli war against the defined scope for the current scope.

column2:
who = <scope>
The country declared against.
casus_belli = <cb>
The casus belli to use.
war_goal_province = <province id>
Optional. Defines the province the war was declared for, if required by the casus belli.
column4: Declares war for the current scope against the defined scope, using the defined casus belli.
column5: Casus belli are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/cb_types/*.txt

column2:
shock = <int>
The shock pips of the leader.
fire = <int>
The fire pips of the leader.
manuever = <int>
The manuever pips of the leader.
siege = <int>
The siege pips of the leader.
name = <string>
Optional. The name of the leader.
female = yes
Optional. Makes the leader female.
trait = <trait>
Optional. A trait automatically assigned to the leader.
column4: Creates an admiral with the defined attributes for the current scope.
column5:
Leader traits can be found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/leader_personalities/*.txt.
Siege improves Blockade Efficiency for admirals.
The name parameter can accept a saved name variable, see set_saved_name for more context.

column2:
type = <type>
The advisor type to create.
skill = <int>
The amount of skill the advisor has. Limited to 3 maximum.
name = <string>
Optional. The name to use.
location = <province id>
Optional. The province that the advisor comes from.
discount = yes

column2:
name = <string>

Optional. The birth date of the heir. Can be used instead of the ageparameter.

Optional. The starting legitimacy of the heir.
adm = <int>
Optional. The minimum ADM skill roll for the heir.
dip = <int>
Optional. The minimum DIP skill roll for the heir.
mil = <int>
Optional. The minimum MIL skill roll for the heir.
fixed = yes
Optional. Makes the heir skill roll fixed to the defined minimums.
max_random_adm = <int>
Optional. The maximum ADM skill roll for the heir.
max_random_dip = <int>
Optional. The maximum DIP skill roll for the heir.
max_random_mil = <int>
Optional. The maximum MIL skill roll for the heir.
hide_skills = yes
Optional. Hides the skill values for this heir. hidden = yes
Optional. Hides the skill values for this heir. Legacy version of hide_skills.no_consort_with_heir = yes
Optional. Makes the heir a child not of the consort, i.e. a bastardfemale = yes
Optional. Forces the heir to be female.
male = yes
Optional. Forces the heir to be male.
culture = <culture> / <scope>
Optional. The culture of the heir.
religion = <religion> / <scope>
Optional. The religion of the heir.

    adm = 6
}

    age = 13
    adm = 3
    dip = 3
    mil = 3
    claim = 50
    female = yes
    no_consort_with_heir = yes
}

yes

column2:
yes

set_ruler_religion = event_target:my_event_target
set_ruler_religion = variable:my_variable
column4: Changes the ruler religion of the current scope.
column5:
Religions are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/religions/*.txt
Can utilise Event Scope Values.

column2:
key = <string>
The key that holds the name.
type = advisor / simple
The name generation type. Advisor draws from namelist, simple utilises name parameter.
name = <string>
The name to hold in the key. Only used with the simple type.
scope = <scope>
The country scope to draw the namelist from. Only used with the advisor type.
column4: Saves a name to an unique key for usage in other effects.
column5: Usable with define_admiral, define_explorer, define_conquistador, define_general, define_ruler, define_consort, define_heir, define_advisor and spawn_rebels.

column2:
who = <who>
Which country to alter opinion with.
opinion = <opinion>
Which opinion state to change to.
column4: Changes the current scope's school opinion towards the defined scope's school.
column5: -1 for negative, 0 for netural and 1 for positive.

column2:
<yes>
Boolean.
column4: Re-evaluates the current scope's national idea set assignment, if they match a different set, they will switch to it.
column5: Used after tag changes to change Nationa Idea sets.

column2:
<scope>
The scope to switch to.
column3:
switch_tag = FRA
switch_tag = ROOT
switch_tag = event_target:my_country
column4: Switches the player view to <scope> tag. Original country becomes controlled by AI.

column2:
<scope>
The province scope in which the transport spawns.
column4: Spawns a transport unit for the current scope in the defined province scope.
column5:
Uses the current scope's current transport unit.
Requires the province scope to have a port.

column2:
<cult>
The cult to unlock.
column4: Adds the defined cult to the current scope.
column5:
Cults can be found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/fetishist_cults/*.txt.
No effect if the country does not hold a religion using fetishist_cult.

column2:
<scope>
The country to vassalize.
column4: Makes the defined scope a vassal subject of the current scope.
column5:
Uses the vassal subject type.
Exact same effect as create_vassal.

column2:
<scope>
The country to force white peace against.
column4: Forces the defined scope into a white peace truce with the current scope.

column2:
<flag>
An unique string to identify the global flag with.
column3:
set_global_flag = my_flag
set_global_flag = my_flag@ROOT
set_global_flag = my_flag@event_target:name
column4: Defines a global flag.
column5: Flags can be appended with scopes or event targets

column2:
<flag>
The unique string of a global flag to clear.
column4: Clears a defined global flag.

column2:
<string>
An localized string to display in the tooltip
column4: Displays a localized key in the effect tooltip.

column2:
<string>
An string to in the game.log
column4: Displays a string in the game.log when executed.
column5: Accepts all localization commands (i.e. [Root.GetName], etc)

column2:
<string>
An unique string to identify the event target with.
column4: Saves the current scope as a key. Is cleared once execution ends (i.e. end of event).
column5: Use event_target:<key> to access the scope.

column2:
<string>
An unique string to identify the global event target with.
column4: Saves the current scope as a key. Persists after execution until cleared via effect.
column5: Use event_target:<key> to access the scope.

column2:
<string>
The unique string of the global event target to clear.
column4: Clears a specific global event target.

column2:
yes
Boolean.
column4: Clears all global event targets.

column2:
<string>
The unique string of the ambient object to show.
column4: Displays a hidden ambient object from the map/ambient_objects.txt file.

column2:
<string>
The unique string of the ambient object to hide.
column4: Hides a visible ambient object from the map/ambient_objects.txt file.
